event_title: Box Size DIE featuring Caustic - live MACBA
event_description: The death metal band Caustic will reactivate the piece Box Size DIE artist João Onofre, part of the exhibition PUNK. His traces in contemporary art. Box Size DIE recovers the aesthetics of the piece Die (1962) Toni Smith to transform it into a sealed container sound proof. Caustic will test him in a peculiar concert, which will last restricted to the amount of oxygen consumed go inside and that the public receive only the vibrations. + Info

B-ANIME Barcelona Anime Festival is a film festival / theater for Free youth. It aims to show films, short films, television series and bring part of Japanese pop culture to our country. Alongside projections workshops, activities, exhibitions, live art and lectures, among other proposals are made. The spirit of the festival is to create an event aimed at teenagers but where the whole family can participate. The festival aims to give visibility to anime productions of unprecedented quality in Barcelona, ​​for business reasons, not reach the big screen. It also wants to be a meeting point for all fans of the genre. For this reason, in addition to the screening of movie premieres, short films series and also numerous activities related to the anime for all audiences will be organized. + Info

Agnès Pe working in the sound beyond the limits set forth by any musical genre. His work is characterized by an attitude of fun and overwhelming, covering the parameters of the lo-fi music and plunderfónica, always looking for new ways to relate to the elements recomposed by atonality, altered screeching melodies and textures. Classic, eurodancesinfónico, melodies punch, blackmidi, happy slapped, terminal punk, humpatech, crossover thrash, not gender, midtechno, Powermid hardlaptop and Speedy are some of the labels to define their music. More information: http://agnespe.bandcamp.com ; http://aggnespe.hotglue.me/ + info

Wunderkammer (literally camera wonderland, places where, at the time of the great explorations, a multitude of rare objects collected them ) is the collaborative and open to ethnological experimentation between the artist and musician Enrique Doza and dj project Xavier Riembau. His live shows are unpredictable sound for planet Earth and beyond improvisations. With the help of a mixer, some dishes, a few pedals, drum machines and keyboards, lead the journey to places that even they have visited. And so far they visited festivals such as LEM, Poesia i +, International Festival of Torre Maria, Recorreguts Sonors and venues such as Hangar, Convent de Sant Agusti and La Isla, among others. Enrique Doza is graphic artist, musician, activist, responsible for Shop Right, TD papers and TNT. He has been a member of bands like Dog Roboto in his native Venezuela or The Burning Ladillas once installed in Barcelona. Meanwhile, Xavier dj Riembau is the name of Diego Armando, a member of the collective Finis Africae and Infra DJ's and responsible for the program ScannerFM Soroll of fons. More information: http://wunderkammer.bandcamp.com/ + info

event_title: BETWEEN NUMBERS AND PIGMENTS - Ricardo Cabret
event_description:
INAUGURATION: Wednesday 7 at 20: 00h.
Discipline: Painting, Drawing, Video-Art
Technique: Oil, Ink, Computer generated graphics.
An algorithm is a set of well-defined instructions that allow us to perform activities through a series of steps. In essence, the algorithm is an abstract concept, strictly governed by logic, order and control. By definition action painting and mixing pigments it can also be defined as an algorithmic process. Unlike numbers, this artistic discipline conspicuous by its imperfection, being sporadic, unpredictable, and irrational.
What happens when a free process like painting and drawing is intertwined with an abstract concept that is defined by instructions and logic?
"Between numbers and pigments" explores a vision that interpolates the computer code used to design algorithms and the physical medium of painting. Tries to show how these two means, more opposed they may seem, in itself share a common denominator: human ingenuity.
+ info
